title: Hostage Testifies About Post-Rescue Meeting With Imam Charged in Kidnapping
title_page: Hostage Testifies About Post-Rescue Meeting With Imam Charged in Kidnapping - The New York Times
maintext:
They each took the witness stand, one after the other on Wednesday in a courtroom in Lower Manhattan: the former hostage and the British imam accused of helping to orchestrate her kidnapping.
The first to testify was Mary Quin, a former Xerox executive from Rochester who was kidnapped in Yemen in 1998 with 15 other tourists; four of the hostages died when they were used as human shields by the kidnappers during a rescue staged by the Yemeni authorities.
Ms. Quin was the final government witness in the trial of Mostafa Kamel Mostafa, a fiery British imam whom prosecutors have charged with hostage-taking, with planning to create a terrorist training camp in Bly, Ore., and with providing assistance to Al Qaeda in Afghanistan, among other charges.
After the prosecution rested, the defense began its case: Mr. Mostafa, 56, took the stand and said he had no role in the kidnapping. He also denied the other charges.
